title: Drought Stress Responses in Plants
text: Drought stress induces abscisic acid (ABA) accumulation in guard cells, triggering stomatal closure through the activation of SLAC1 ion channels. Jasmonic acid (JA) enhances this response by upregulating MYC2 transcription factors. Reactive oxygen species (ROS) mediate signaling pathways, activating calcium channels.

title: Jasmonate Signaling in Plant Stress Responses
text: Jasmonic acid (JA) regulates stomatal closure during drought stress by inducing MYC2 transcription factor activity. JAZ repressors inhibit MYC2 under normal conditions, while ROS production enhances JA signaling during stress. Calcium signaling plays a crucial role in guard cell responses.

title: Calcium Signaling in Stomatal Regulation
text: Calcium oscillations in guard cells activate SLAC1 channels through CDPK kinases. ABA-induced ROS production triggers calcium release, enhancing stomatal closure. Nitric oxide (NO) modulates this process by activating cGMP signaling pathways.
